extracted_information: The web content provides a comprehensive performance comparison between Tauri and Electron, focusing on memory efficiency, startup performance, and bundle size. The analysis is backed by practical benchmarks conducted on a MacBook Pro, displaying clear differences in resource consumption and build characteristics between the two frameworks. The article also discusses the architectural reasons behind these performance discrepancies.

tauri.context: yarn tauri build total time (380.11s user 28.37s system 504% cpu 1:20.94 total)

electron.context: yarn make total time (13.23s user 1.55s system 93% cpu 15.818 total)

features.runtime_packaging: None (Rust compiles to native binary, no Node.js runtime bundled)
features.memory_efficiency_reason: Uses system's WebView, lighter than full Chromium; no Node.js runtime overhead.
features.bundle_size_reason: No bundled JavaScript runtime (Node.js), uses system's WebView instead of bundling Chromium.

process_model.renderer_process: Single browser tab spawned by main process (mini-Chromium instance for each window)

features.memory_efficiency_reason: Higher memory consumption due to Node.js runtime and multiple Chromium-based renderer processes.
features.bundle_size_reason: Bundles Node.js runtime and entire Chromium engine.

references: https://github.com/Elanis/web-to-desktop-framework-comparison?ref=hopp#benchmarks (Web to Desktop Framework Comparison repository for more detailed benchmark data)
